channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Unmasking the Chameleons: A Benchmark for Out-of-Distribution Detection in Medical Tabular Data
item.description: Despite their success, Machine Learning (ML) models do not generalize effectively to data not originating from the training distribution.

item.title: KLoB: a Benchmark for Assessing Knowledge Locating Methods in Language Models
item.description: KLoB can serve as a benchmark for evaluating existing locating methods in language models, and can contributes a method to reassessing the validity of locality hypothesis of factual knowledge.

item.title: Text-to-3D using Gaussian Splatting
item.description: In this stage, we increase the number of Gaussians by compactness-based densification to enhance continuity and improve fidelity.

item.title: Logarithm-transform aided Gaussian Sampling for Few-Shot Learning
item.description: These methods rely on transforming the distributions of experimental data to approximate Gaussian distributions for their functioning.

item.title: End-to-end Risk Prediction of Atrial Fibrillation from the 12-Lead ECG by Deep Neural Networks
item.description: Background: Atrial fibrillation (AF) is one of the most common cardiac arrhythmias that affects millions of people each year worldwide and it is closely linked to increased risk of cardiovascular diseases such as stroke and heart failure.

item.title: FORB: A Flat Object Retrieval Benchmark for Universal Image Embedding
item.description: Image retrieval is a fundamental task in computer vision.

item.title: LagrangeBench: A Lagrangian Fluid Mechanics Benchmarking Suite
item.description: Machine learning has been successfully applied to grid-based PDE modeling in various scientific applications.

item.title: On the Challenges of Fully Incremental Neural Dependency Parsing
item.description: Since the popularization of BiLSTMs and Transformer-based bidirectional encoders, state-of-the-art syntactic parsers have lacked incrementality, requiring access to the whole sentence and deviating from human language processing.

item.title: GAFlow: Incorporating Gaussian Attention into Optical Flow
item.description: Moreover, for reliable motion analysis, we provide a new Gaussian-Guided Attention Module (GGAM) which not only inherits properties from Gaussian distribution to instinctively revolve around the neighbor fields of each point but also is empowered to put the emphasis on contextually related regions during matching.

item.title: Compositional Sculpting of Iterative Generative Processes
item.description: A key challenge in composing iterative generative processes, such as GFlowNets and diffusion models, is that to realize the desired target distribution, all steps of the generative process need to be coordinated, and satisfy delicate balance conditions.

item.title: T-COL: Generating Counterfactual Explanations for General User Preferences on Variable Machine Learning Systems
item.description: However, the application of CEs has been hindered by two main challenges, namely general user preferences and variable ML systems.

item.title: Learning to Terminate in Object Navigation
item.description: This paper tackles the critical challenge of object navigation in autonomous navigation systems, particularly focusing on the problem of target approach and episode termination in environments with long optimal episode length in Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) based methods.

item.title: ShapeDBA: Generating Effective Time Series Prototypes using ShapeDTW Barycenter Averaging
item.description: Our approach uses a new form of time series average, the ShapeDTW Barycentric Average.

item.title: SA2-Net: Scale-aware Attention Network for Microscopic Image Segmentation
item.description: Specifically, we propose scale-aware attention (SA2) module designed to capture inherent variations in scales and shapes of microscopic regions, such as cells, for accurate segmentation.

item.title: ModuLoRA: Finetuning 3-Bit LLMs on Consumer GPUs by Integrating with Modular Quantizers
item.description: We propose a memory-efficient finetuning algorithm for large language models (LLMs) that supports finetuning LLMs with 65B parameters in 3-bit or 4-bit precision on as little as one 48GB GPU.

item.title: Geodesic Regression Characterizes 3D Shape Changes in the Female Brain During Menstruation
item.description: We seek to investigate this connection by developing tools that quantify 3D shape changes that occur in the brain during sex hormone fluctuations.

item.title: Unlikelihood Tuning on Negative Samples Amazingly Improves Zero-Shot Translation
item.description: Zero-shot translation (ZST), which is generally based on a multilingual neural machine translation model, aims to translate between unseen language pairs in training data.

item.title: Deep Geometrized Cartoon Line Inbetweening
item.description: To preserve the precision and detail of the line drawings, we propose a new approach, AnimeInbet, which geometrizes raster line drawings into graphs of endpoints and reframes the inbetweening task as a graph fusion problem with vertex repositioning.

item.title: Improving Equivariance in State-of-the-Art Supervised Depth and Normal Predictors
item.description: Dense depth and surface normal predictors should possess the equivariant property to cropping-and-resizing -- cropping the input image should result in cropping the same output image.

item.title: LawBench: Benchmarking Legal Knowledge of Large Language Models
item.description: We hope this benchmark provides in-depth understanding of the LLMs' domain-specified capabilities and speed up the development of LLMs in the legal domain.

item.title: Learning to Transform for Generalizable Instance-wise Invariance
item.description: However, too much or too little invariance can hurt, and the correct amount is unknown a priori and dependent on the instance.

item.title: Mixup Your Own Pairs
item.description: In representation learning, regression has traditionally received less attention than classification.

item.title: HTC-DC Net: Monocular Height Estimation from Single Remote Sensing Images
item.description: To tackle this problem, we propose a method for monocular height estimation from optical imagery, which is currently one of the richest sources of remote sensing data.

item.title: Generalizable Heterogeneous Federated Cross-Correlation and Instance Similarity Learning
item.description: Federated learning is an important privacy-preserving multi-party learning paradigm, involving collaborative learning with others and local updating on private data.

item.title: Demystifying CLIP Data
item.description: We believe that the main ingredient to the success of CLIP is its data and not the model architecture or pre-training objective.

item.title: Dark Side Augmentation: Generating Diverse Night Examples for Metric Learning
item.description: We propose to train a GAN-based synthetic-image generator, translating available day-time image examples into night images.

item.title: At Which Training Stage Does Cocde Data Help LLMs Reasoning?
item.description: Inspired by the great success of code data in training LLMs, we naturally wonder at which training stage introducing code data can really help LLMs reasoning.

item.title: Prompt-and-Align: Prompt-Based Social Alignment for Few-Shot Fake News Detection
item.description: Despite considerable advances in automated fake news detection, due to the timely nature of news, it remains a critical open question how to effectively predict the veracity of news articles based on limited fact-checks.

item.title: Beyond Citations: Text-Based Metrics for Assessing Novelty and its Impact in Scientific Publications
item.description: Our findings support the use of text mining both to measure novel scientific ideas at the time of publication and to measure the impact of these new ideas on later scientific work.

item.title: Decoding the Workplace & EOR: An Employee Survey Analysis by Data Science Techniques and Visualization
item.description: This research study explores the new dynamics of employee-organi-zation relationships (EOR) [6] using advanced data science methodologies and presents findings through accessible visualizations.

item.title: The Trickle-down Impact of Reward (In-)consistency on RLHF
item.description: We propose Contrast Instructions -- a benchmarking strategy for the consistency of RM.

item.title: Transformer-VQ: Linear-Time Transformers via Vector Quantization
item.description: We introduce Transformer-VQ, a decoder-only transformer computing softmax-based dense self-attention in linear time.

item.title: Augment to Interpret: Unsupervised and Inherently Interpretable Graph Embeddings
item.description: Unsupervised learning allows us to leverage unlabelled data, which has become abundantly available, and to create embeddings that are usable on a variety of downstream tasks.

item.title: AtomSurf : Surface Representation for Learning on Protein Structures
item.description: An essential aspect of learning from protein structures is representing these structures as a geometric object (be it a grid, graph, or surface) and applying a learning method tailored to this representation.

item.title: A Physics Informed Machine Learning Method for Power System Model Parameter Optimization
item.description: This paper proposes a gradient descent based optimization method that relies on automatic differentiation for the computation of gradients.

item.title: Cross-Prediction-Powered Inference
item.description: We show that cross-prediction is consistently more powerful than an adaptation of prediction-powered inference in which a fraction of the labeled data is split off and used to train the model.

item.title: Training a Large Video Model on a Single Machine in a Day
item.description: Videos are big, complex to pre-process, and slow to train on.

item.title: Controllable Text Generation with Residual Memory Transformer
item.description: Large-scale Causal Language Models (CLMs), e. g., GPT3 and ChatGPT, have brought great success in text generation.

item.title: Algebraic and Statistical Properties of the Ordinary Least Squares Interpolator
item.description: Deep learning research has uncovered the phenomenon of benign overfitting for over-parameterized statistical models, which has drawn significant theoretical interest in recent years.

item.title: End-to-End Streaming Video Temporal Action Segmentation with Reinforce Learning
item.description: The end-to-end SVTAS which regard TAS as an action segment clustering task can expand the application scenarios of TAS; and RL is used to alleviate the problem of inconsistent optimization objective and direction.

item.title: Lyra: Orchestrating Dual Correction in Automated Theorem Proving
item.description: In addition, we introduce Conjecture Correction, an error feedback mechanism designed to interact with prover to refine formal proof conjectures with prover error messages.

item.title: Digital Twin-based Anomaly Detection with Curriculum Learning in Cyber-physical Systems
item.description: LATTICE also, on average, reduces the training time of ATTAIN by 4. 2% on the five datasets and is on par with the baselines in terms of detection delay time.

item.title: Context-Aware Entity Grounding with Open-Vocabulary 3D Scene Graphs
item.description: We present an Open-Vocabulary 3D Scene Graph (OVSG), a formal framework for grounding a variety of entities, such as object instances, agents, and regions, with free-form text-based queries.

item.title: Temporal graph models fail to capture global temporal dynamics
item.description: We outline our observations and propose a trivial optimization-free baseline of "recently popular nodes" outperforming other methods on all medium and large-size datasets in the Temporal Graph Benchmark.

item.title: NLPBench: Evaluating Large Language Models on Solving NLP Problems
item.description: Recent developments in large language models (LLMs) have shown promise in enhancing the capabilities of natural language processing (NLP).

item.title: C3Net: interatomic potential neural network for prediction of physicochemical properties in heterogenous systems
item.description: Understanding the interactions of a solute with its environment is of fundamental importance in chemistry and biology.

item.title: GNNHLS: Evaluating Graph Neural Network Inference via High-Level Synthesis
item.description: In this paper, we propose GNNHLS, an open-source framework to comprehensively evaluate GNN inference acceleration on FPGAs via HLS, containing a software stack for data generation and baseline deployment, and FPGA implementations of 6 well-tuned GNN HLS kernels.

item.title: ChatCounselor: A Large Language Models for Mental Health Support
item.description: This paper presents ChatCounselor, a large language model (LLM) solution designed to provide mental health support.

item.title: Automatic Feature Fairness in Recommendation via Adversaries
item.description: We leverage the Adaptive Adversarial perturbation based on the widely-applied Factorization Machine (AAFM) as our backbone model.

item.title: A Survey of Chain of Thought Reasoning: Advances, Frontiers and Future
item.description: Chain-of-thought reasoning, a cognitive process fundamental to human intelligence, has garnered significant attention in the realm of artificial intelligence and natural language processing.
